sen.j: 木村 荘平（きむら しょうへい、1841年7月 - 1906年4月27日）は、山城国（現在の京都府）出身の実業家、政治家である。
sen.e: Shohei KIMURA (July 1841-April 27, 1906) was a businessman and a statesman from the Province of Yamashiro.
Shohei KIMURA (July, 1841 - April 27, 1906) was a businessman and a statesman from the Province of Yamashiro (current Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 現在の京都府の訳が欠けています。追加しました。
sen.e: Shohei KIMURA (July, 1841 - April 27, 1906) was a businessman and a statesman from the Province of Yamashiro (current Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: いろは合名会社社長、東京家畜市場会社（屠場）理事、東京諸畜売肉商（肉卸問屋）組合頭取、東京博善株式会社（火葬場）社長、東京本芝浦鉱泉株式会社（温泉つき割烹旅館）社長、日本麦酒醸造会社（ヱビスビール）社長、東京商業会議所議員、日本商家同志会顧問、芝区議会議員、東京市議会議員、東京府議会議員。
sen.e: He held the following positions: president of Iroha Gomei Kaisha, Director of Tokyo Cattle Market Company (slaughter house), Chief of Tokyo meat sellers association (whole sale meat sellers), president of Tokyo Hakuzen Company Ltd., (crematory), president of Tokyo Shibaura Kosen Company Ltd. (Japanese - style restaurant with in-house hot springs), president of Japan Beer Company Ltd. (Ebisu Beer), councilor Tokyo Chamber of Commerce, advisor to Japan Businessman's Association, elected representative to Shiba Ward,city council member Tokyo City Assembly, council member to Tokyo Prefectural Assembly.

He held the following positions: president of Iroha Gomei Kaisha, Director of Tokyo Cattle Market Company (butcher house); Chief of Tokyo meat sellers association (whole sale meat sellers); president of Tokyo Hakuzen Company Ltd., (crematory); president of Tokyo Shibaura Kosen Company Ltd. (Japanese - style hotel with restaurant, equipped with in-house hot springs); president of Japan Beer Company Ltd. (Ebisu Beer); councilor of Tokyo Chamber of Commerce; advisor to Japan Businessman's Association; elected representative to Shiba Ward; city council member of Tokyo City Assembly; council member to Tokyo Prefectural Assembly.
sen.cmt: 各役職はコンマでなく「;」で区切りました。屠殺場は「slaughter house」だと間違いではありませんがきつい訳になります。「butcher house」としました。その他前置詞の追加や、いくつか説明の加筆を行っています。
sen.e: He held the following positions: president of Iroha Gomei Kaisha, Director of Tokyo Cattle Market Company (butcher house); Chief of Tokyo meat sellers association (whole sale meat sellers); president of Tokyo Hakuzen Company Ltd., (crematory); president of Tokyo Shibaura Kosen Company Ltd. (Japanese - style hotel with restaurant, equipped with in-house hot springs); president of Japan Beer Company Ltd. (Ebisu Beer); councilor of Tokyo Chamber of Commerce; advisor to Japan Businessman's Association; elected representative to Shiba Ward; city council member of Tokyo City Assembly; council member to Tokyo Prefectural Assembly.

sen.j: 当時日本最大の牛鍋チェーン店「いろは」を経営し、「いろは大王」と謳われた。
sen.e: He operated the biggest gyunabe (beef pot) chain stores in Japan at the time which was called "Iroha King".
He operated the biggest gyunabe (beef pot) chain restaurants in Japan of the days called the restaurants "Iroha," thus he was called "the King Iroha."
sen.cmt: ここではレストランとした方が意味が伝わりやすいと思います。当時の訳を変更しました。店名である「いろは」が訳に欠けており、牛鍋「いろは」が「いろは大王」と呼ばれたと誤訳しています。これは木村が「いろは大王」と呼ばれたという意味です。
sen.e: He operated the biggest gyunabe (beef pot) chain restaurants in Japan of the days called the restaurants "Iroha," thus he was called "the King Iroha."

tit.cmt: personal Profileと片方が小文字になっていて不自然ですので、修正しました。

tit.e: Around the time of the Restoration
Around the time of the Meiji Restoration
tit.cmt: 「維新」のみで理解できるのは日本人だけです。「明治」を追加しました。
tit.e: Around the time of the Meiji Restoration

sen.j: 1841年（天保12年）7月、山城国伏見（現在の京都市伏見区）に生まれる。
sen.e: In July 1841, he was born in Fushimi of Yamashiro Province (current Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: 訳抜けです。訳を入れました。
sen.e: In July 1841, he was born in Fushimi of Yamashiro Province (current Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: 幼名鹿蔵。
sen.e: His childhood name was Shikazo.
His childhood name was Rokuzo.
sen.cmt: 「しかぞう」の読みは不自然に思います。「ろくぞう」としました。
sen.e: His childhood name was Rokuzo.

sen.j: 生家は代々の茶師で、徳川家康以来、公方様御用と禁裡御用を務めた。
sen.e: His family was in the chashi business for generations and supplied Kuge-sama and the Imperial household since the days of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

His family had been in chashi (tea producer) business for generations, and served as purveyors of tea to Kubo-house (shogun family) and the Imperial household since the days of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Edo Period.
sen.cmt: 茶師の説明を加えました。単純に「supply」だと御用の意味が伝わりませんので、御用達の意味を加えました。江戸時代以降の話ですので、公方様は公家ではなく、将軍家を指します。修正しました。徳川家康だけではわからない外国人も多いと思います。「江戸時代を通じて代々」の意味もありますので、「江戸時代」の訳を追加しました。
sen.e: His family had been in chashi (tea producer) business for generations, and served as purveyors of tea to Kubo-house (shogun family) and the Imperial household since the days of Ieyasu TOKUGAWA in Edo Period.

sen.j: 父が宇治田原（現在の京都府綴喜郡宇治田原町）の木村家に夫婦養子に入った後、理由あって上林家に戻ったが、そのとき鹿蔵のみ木村家に残されたという。
sen.e: When his parents returned to Uebayashi family for some reason after adopted as husband and wife by Kimura family in Ujitawara (present Ujitawara-cho, Tsuzuki County, Kyoto Prefecture), Shikazo was left at Kimura family.

While his father was once adopted by Kimura family in Ujitawara (present Ujitawara-cho, Tsuzuki County, Kyoto Prefecture) along with his wife, later both returned to the original Uebayashi family for some reason; on this occasion, only Rokuzo was left under the custody of the Kimura family.
sen.cmt: 訳が直訳的で意味がわかりづらいため、意訳の上修正しています。
sen.e: While his father was once adopted by Kimura family in Ujitawara (present Ujitawara-cho, Tsuzuki County, Kyoto Prefecture) along with his wife, later both returned to the original Uebayashi family for some reason; on this occasion, only Rokuzo was left under the custody of the Kimura family.

sen.j: 幼時より悪戯と喧嘩を好み、7歳で寺子屋に預けられたが学業は不振で、3年間の勉学の後も自らの姓名しか書けなかったと伝えられる。
sen.e: Throughout his childhood, he liked mischief and fight over study and he was sent to terakoya school at age seven even though it was reported that he could barely write his own name after studying there for three years.
Throughout his childhood, he liked mischief and fight over study; although he was sent to terakoya school at age seven, it is said that he could barely write his own name after three years of study.
sen.cmt: 文が「run-on」化するのを避けるため、「;」で分割しています。整理して単純化しています。
sen.e: Throughout his childhood, he liked mischief and fight over study; although he was sent to terakoya school at age seven, it is said that he could barely write his own name after three years of study.

sen.j: 1855年に力士を志して家出し、大坂の小野川秀五郎に入門。
sen.e: In 1855, he left home to become sumo wrestler and became a disciple of Shugoro ONOKAWA in Osaka.
In 1855, he left home intended to become a sumo wrestler, and became a disciple of Shugoro ONOKAWA in Osaka.
sen.cmt: マイナー修正です。不定冠詞を追加しています。
sen.e: In 1855, he left home intended to become a sumo wrestler, and became a disciple of Shugoro ONOKAWA in Osaka.

sen.j: 程なく生家に連れ戻されたが、放蕩が祟って1868年に勘当を受ける。
sen.e: He was soon brought back home but he was disowned in 1868 as a result of his debauchery.
He was soon brought back home but he was disowned in 1868 as a result of his debauchery.
He was soon brought back home but he was disowned in 1868 as a result of his debauchery.

sen.j: 家を出されてからは伏見で青物屋を開いて成功。
sen.e: After he was disowned, he opened a successful vegetable store.
After he was disowned, he opened a vegetable store, which became successful.
sen.cmt: 原文では「青物屋を開いて成功した」とありますが、訳文は意訳して「成功した青物屋」と時間的流れを圧縮してしまっています。原文に即し修正しました。
sen.e: After he was disowned, he opened a vegetable store, which became successful.

sen.j: 1861年、青物問屋23軒の組合を作り、取締役となる。
sen.e: In 1861, he organized 23 vegetable warehouse merchants to form an association and become the director of the association.
In 1861, he organized an association formed by 23 vegetable warehouse merchants and became its director.
sen.cmt: 語順を修正し、単純化しました。「取締役となる」を現在形で訳していましたので修正しました。
sen.e: In 1861, he organized an association formed by 23 vegetable warehouse merchants and became its director.

sen.j: 1868年の鳥羽伏見の戦いで薩摩藩御用をつとめたが、売掛金を踏み倒されて倒産。
sen.e: During the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he supplied Satsuma Domain but went bankrupt due to no payment received.
During the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he served as purveyors to the Satsuma Domain, but he went bankrupt because the Satsuma Domain bilked Shohei for his accounts receivable.
sen.cmt: 売掛金(account receivable)、踏み倒す(bilk (a person))などの意味に沿って訂正しました。
sen.e: During the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, he served as purveyors to the Satsuma Domain, but he went bankrupt because the Satsuma Domain bilked Shohei for his accounts receivable.

sen.j: 1870年、神戸市栄町通 (神戸市)に資本金30万円で製茶貿易商店を設立するも、事業不振により倒産。
sen.e: In 1870, he opened Tea Trading store in Sakaecho-dori in Kobe with a capital of 300,000 yen but went bankrupt because of slump in business.
In 1870, he opened a tea manufacturing and trading store in Sakaecho-dori in Kobe City with a capital of 300,000 yen, but he went bankrupt because of slump in business.
sen.cmt: 製茶が訳に欠けていますので追加しました。神戸市の市が訳がかけていましたので追加しました。店は固有名で示されていませんので、不定冠詞を追加、大文字を小文字にしました。
sen.e: In 1870, he opened a tea manufacturing and trading store in Sakaecho-dori in Kobe City with a capital of 300,000 yen, but he went bankrupt because of slump in business.

sen.j: その後も何度か事業の失敗を繰り返した。
sen.e: He repeated a number of business failures afterwards.
He went through multiple failures in business even after those bankruptcies in his earlier career.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくなるよう表現を変更しました。
sen.e: He went through multiple failures in business even after those bankruptcies in his earlier career.

tit.e: Post the Restoration in Tokyo Prefecture
His career in post-Meiji Restoration era Tokyo
tit.cmt: 先述の通り「明治維新」と修正しました。訳では意味が通じないため、意訳し修正しました。
tit.e: His career in post-Meiji Restoration era Tokyo

sen.j: 1878年（明治11年）、鳥羽伏見以来の縁により、内務卿・大久保利通の懐刀と呼ばれた薩摩藩出身の警視庁 (内務省)大警視（のちの警視総監）の川路利良の招きを受けて上京し、明治政府から官営屠場の払い下げを受けて成功。
sen.e: In 1878, through the Toba-Fushimi connection, he went to Tokyo at the invitation of Toshiyoshi KAWAJI from Statsuma Domain who was Daikeishi (top of the police department) of Keishi-cho (Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, domestic affairs division) and a right-hand to Secretary of Interior Toshimitsu OKUBO and received a disposed government-run slaughter house from Meiji Government whic became successful.

In 1878, he went to Tokyo at the invitation of a former retainer of the Satsuma Domain, and Daikeishi (top of the police department) of Keishi-cho (Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, domestic affairs division) in Meiji government Toshiyoshi KAWAJI, who was a right-hand man to the Secretary of Interior, Toshimitsu OKUBO (also a former retainer of the Satsuma Domain), through the relationship between Shohei and the Satsuma Domain during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi; Shohei received a disposed government-managed butcher house from Meiji Government, which brought him a success.
sen.cmt: 内容重要度に合わせ語順を修正しました。「鳥羽伏見以来の縁」を「Toba-Fushimi connection」としていますが、省略し過ぎていたため、訳出し直しました。さらに「薩摩藩出身」などの説明も訳出しています。
sen.e: In 1878, he went to Tokyo at the invitation of a former retainer of the Satsuma Domain, and Daikeishi (top of the police department) of Keishi-cho (Tokyo Metropolitan Police Department, domestic affairs division) in Meiji government Toshiyoshi KAWAJI, who was a right-hand man to the Secretary of Interior, Toshimitsu OKUBO (also a former retainer of the Satsuma Domain), through the relationship between Shohei and the Satsuma Domain during the Battle of Toba-Fushimi; Shohei received a disposed government-managed butcher house from Meiji Government, which brought him a success.

sen.j: 同年から牛鍋チェーン店「いろは」を経営。
sen.e: He opened a gyunabe (beef pot) chain stores "Iroha" in the same year.
In the same year, he opened gyunabe (beef pot) chain restaurants "Iroha" and managed himself.
sen.cmt: 「経営」の意味を追加しました。チェーン店をchain restaurantsとしました。チェーン店である以上、単独ではないため不定冠詞を削除し、restaurantsとしています。
sen.e: In the same year, he opened gyunabe (beef pot) chain restaurants "Iroha" and managed himself.

sen.j: 芝区三田四国町（現在の港区 (東京都)芝 (東京都港区)3丁目）の一号店（第一いろは）をはじめとして、東京市内20箇所にのぼる支店にそれぞれ愛人を配置して各店の経営にあたらせた。
sen.e: He opened the first store (Daiichi Iroha) in Mitashikoku-cho, Shiba-ward (present 3 chome, Shiba, Minato-ku, Tokyo) and additional stores 20 in all in Tokyo Metropolitan area and had his mistresses run each of the stores.

He opened the first restaurant (Daiichi Iroha) in Mitashikoku-cho, Shiba Ward (current Shiba 3 chome, Minato Ward, Tokyo) and 20 branch restaurants throughout Tokyo area, while he had each of the branch restaurants managed by one of his mistresses.
sen.cmt: 芝区、港区など、また英語式のアドレス表記に修正しました。20→20 branch restaurants文法を修正しました。
sen.e: He opened the first restaurant (Daiichi Iroha) in Mitashikoku-cho, Shiba Ward (current Shiba 3 chome, Minato Ward, Tokyo) and 20 branch restaurants throughout Tokyo area, while he had each of the branch restaurants managed by one of his mistresses.

sen.j: 傍ら、東京府下15区6郡の肉問屋を糾合して東京諸畜売肉商組合を結成すると共に、1887年（明治20年）には東京家畜市場会社の理事に就任。
sen.e: On the other hand, he organized wholesale meat sellers in 15 wards and 6 counties in Tokyo Prefecture to form Tokyo Meat Sellers Association along with establishing Tokyo Cattle Market Company and assumed the position of the director.

At the same time, he organized the Tokyo Meat Sellers Association by calling together those wholesale meat sellers in Tokyo Prefecture from 15 wards and 6 districts, while he also became a member of the board of directors for the Tokyo Cattle Market Company.
sen.cmt: On the other handの用法が正しくありません。修正しました。 郡の訳をcountyからdistrictとしました。「糾合」を訳出しました。「理事」の訳を一般的な訳に修正しました。
sen.e: At the same time, he organized the Tokyo Meat Sellers Association by calling together those wholesale meat sellers in Tokyo Prefecture from 15 wards and 6 districts, while he also became a member of the board of directors for the Tokyo Cattle Market Company.

sen.j: 同年、日暮里村の火葬場運営を請け負う東京博善会社を設立。
sen.e: He established Tokyo Hakuzen Kaisha that undertook to run a crematory in Nippori village in the same year.
In the same year, he established the Tokyo Hakuzen Company that undertook the management of a crematory service in Nippori village.
In the same year, he established the Tokyo Hakuzen Company that undertook the management of a crematory service in Nippori village.

sen.j: 理事を経て社長となる。
sen.e: He became the president after assuming a director's position.
He first became the member of the board of directors, and later he became the president of the company.
sen.cmt: director's position→member of the board of directors
sen.e: He first became the member of the board of directors, and later he became the president of the company.

sen.j: さらに同年、日本麦酒醸造会社を設立し、社長に就任。
sen.e: Furthermore, he established Japan Beer Company Ltd. (Ebisu Beer) and became the president.
sen.cmt: 訳抜けです。訳を入れました。
sen.e: Furthermore, he established Japan Beer Company Ltd. (Ebisu Beer) and became the president.

sen.j: また、ほかにも東京本芝浦鉱泉株式会社を経営、同社の温泉付旅館「芝浜館」と料亭「芝浦館」は、芝浦埋め立て以前のリゾート施設として成功した。
sen.e: Along with those businesses, he also managed the Tokyo Shibaura Kosen Company Ltd.; this company's "Shibahama-kan Hotel" attached with its own hot spring, and "Shibaura-kan," a first-class Japanese restaurant, became successful as resort facilities in Shibaura, before Shibaura seashore area was reclaimed for land space.
sen.cmt: 訳抜けです。訳を入れました。
sen.e: Along with those businesses, he also managed the Tokyo Shibaura Kosen Company Ltd.; this company's "Shibahama-kan Hotel" attached with its own hot spring, and "Shibaura-kan," a first-class Japanese restaurant, became successful as resort facilities in Shibaura, before Shibaura seashore area was reclaimed for land space.

sen.j: 政治的には星亨の派閥に属し、1896年（明治29年）、東京市会議員に当選。
sen.e: He was politically aligned with Toru HOSHI's sect and was elected as a member of Tokyo City Council in 1896.
He was politically aligned with the sect of Toru HOSHI, and in 1896, Shohei was elected as a member of Tokyo City Council.
sen.cmt: Toru HOSHI's sect→the sect of Toru HOSHI
sen.e: He was politically aligned with the sect of Toru HOSHI, and in 1896, Shohei was elected as a member of Tokyo City Council.

sen.j: 東京府会議員から衆議院進出を計画していた矢先、1906年（明治39年）4月27日に顎癌で死去。
sen.e: He died from jaw cancer when he was just about to run for the House of Representatives from Tokyo Prefectural Assembly.
He died on April 27, 1906 for the cancer in jaw area, while he was just about to run for the House of Representatives from Tokyo Prefectural Assembly.
sen.cmt: 顎癌は、説明不足です。顎部はいろいろな部位があるため、上顎の場合鼻腔や喉頭癌にもつながります。特定できないのでJaw areaと修正しました。死亡日時が欠落しています。
sen.e: He died on April 27, 1906 for the cancer in jaw area, while he was just about to run for the House of Representatives from Tokyo Prefectural Assembly.

sen.j: 享年67。
sen.e: His age at death was 67.
His age at death was 67.
His age at death was 67.

sen.j: 長女栄子が木村曙の筆名で作家として知られた他、四男木村荘太も作家、六男荘六は奇術師木村マリニー、八男木村荘八は画家、十男木村荘十は直木賞作家、十二男木村荘十二は映画監督となった。
sen.e: His first daughter Eiko was known as a novelist with a pen name of Akebono KIMURA, his fourth son Sota was also a novelist, the sixth son Shoroku was a magician with a stage name Marini KIMURA, the eighth son Shohachi was a painter, the tenth son Soju was a novelist who won the Naoki prize and the twelfth son Sojuni was a movie director.

His first daughter Eiko was known as a novelist with a pen name of Akebono KIMURA; his fourth son Sota KIMURA was also a novelist; the sixth son Shoroku was known as a magician with a stage name of Marini KIMURA; the eighth son Shohachi KIMURA was a painter; the tenth son Soju KIMURA was a novelist who won the Naoki prize; the twelfth son Sojuni KIMURA was a movie director.
sen.cmt: 各人物は会社名と同様、「;」で区切りました。なお原文では各子供に木村名が付いていたりいなかったりしますが、妾腹の子供の場合木村姓ではない、などの理由も考えられます。一応原文に倣いました。
sen.e: His first daughter Eiko was known as a novelist with a pen name of Akebono KIMURA; his fourth son Sota KIMURA was also a novelist; the sixth son Shoroku was known as a magician with a stage name of Marini KIMURA; the eighth son Shohachi KIMURA was a painter; the tenth son Soju KIMURA was a novelist who won the Naoki prize; the twelfth son Sojuni KIMURA was a movie director.

sen.j: 「いろは」チェーンは養子の荘蔵が引き継いだが、数年で没落した。
sen.e: His adopted son Shozo took over the "Iroha" chain but let it go bankrupt in a few years.
His adopted son Shozo took over the "Iroha" chain, but he ruined the success of the chain in just a few years.
sen.cmt: 「没落した」に関して、実際に破産し消滅したのか確認が取れませんので、「ruin」で修正しました。
sen.e: His adopted son Shozo took over the "Iroha" chain, but he ruined the success of the chain in just a few years.
